content: The "Elder Pride Act of 2018" amends the Older Americans Act of 1965 to include definitions for LGBT individuals and older LGBT individuals. It also establishes an Office of Older LGBT Policy. The "Elder Pride Act of 2018" amends the Older Americans Act of 1965 to establish an Office of Older LGBT Policy within the Administration. The Office will be headed by a Director who will coordinate activities to improve services for older LGBT individuals and advocate for their rights at the federal and state levels. The Office of Older LGBT Policy will collaborate with federal agencies and states to enhance services for older LGBT individuals, conduct research on LGBT aging, collect and share information on challenges faced by this group, recommend beneficial policies, and promote culturally competent care. The Office of Older LGBT Policy will recommend policies and priorities for older LGBT individuals, administer grants, and submit reports to Congress on activities every five years. SEC. 423. RURAL OUTREACH GRANT PROGRAM. Part A of title IV of the Older Americans Act of 1965 is amended to include a new grant program for rural outreach. The section defines key terms like Director and eligible entity, focusing on providing resources for connecting with older LGBT individuals in rural areas. The section aims to provide grants to eligible entities for creating strategies to connect with older LGBT individuals in rural areas. Eligible entities must submit applications detailing proposed activities and the population served in rural areas. The grant application must include a description of proposed activities, the population in rural areas served, resources available, intent to partner with local organizations, evidence of meeting urgent needs, and any other necessary information determined by the Director. Grants are only available for activities approved by the Director. The Director approves activities for grants under this section to create partnerships between older LGBT individuals in rural areas and eligible entities. Approved activities may include education, community outreach, reducing isolation, improving access to care, and fostering relationships with service providers. The Director establishes standards and guidelines for approved activities supported by grants under this section, allowing eligible entities to adapt them based on local circumstances. The activities aim to build relationships between older LGBT individuals in rural areas and service providers, improve cultural competency, and expand non-discrimination policies. The eligible entity receiving a grant under this section can refine or adapt standards and guidelines for individual projects based on local circumstances. They must cooperate and coordinate with relevant state and local agencies, as well as public and private organizations serving older LGBT individuals, prioritizing those that cater to economically underserved populations. The eligible entity receiving a grant under this section must prioritize cooperating with organizations serving economically underserved populations. The Director must submit a report to Congress every second fiscal year detailing activities from the previous two years.
